Being in lockdown throughout  2020, I had the pleasure to play through the Half Life and Portal Franchise. After hearing nothing but good things about this game, I could not help but try it out. Indeed, Half Life 2 should be remembered as a Classic FPS game that many should follow.

Gameplay(10/10)
Indeed, the game is fast-paced and never let you get bored in any situation. Most games might have some boring sections that is due to padding or a mechanic they don't like. But every part of Half Life 2 is non-stop masterful action. The gunplay is very solid with each gun having a very distinct and unique style to their own, despite being less in number compared to the original Half Life. The Gravity Gun in general is the most innovative of them all, allowing you to manipulate the still-masterful physics of the game to your enjoyment, as each object can be a makeshift bullet ready to be thrown at supersonic speeds.

Story(9/10)
Each level also has its own atmosphere, from the vast yet quiet East European landscapes with your buggy, the desolate dystopian City 17 and the metallic Citadel. It's unique sci-fi horror with Orwellian elements makes it stand out from the FPS market. 
It's story is rather light,but still considered to be very well told. It manages to give you enough info about the world while maintaining an aura of mystery through its atmosphere. The characters given their limited screen time do leave a lasting impression, Alyx,Barney,Eli and more does well enough to be likable companions in an otherwise isolated perspective throughout the game. In total, you might end up taking 13-15 hours to beat, which is considered a lengthy story given the standard 6-7 hours of the game.

Technical(10/10)
It's good to say that Half Life 2 is superbly optimized, running extremely well on Windows 10. So don't feel worried about buying this game. Haven't experienced any crashes in my playthrough.

Audio(10/10)
The audio while not as iconic as the original, still stands well in it's own right. The environmental sounds from the radio of the Combine to the intimidating gunshots, it does well on it's job. The soundtrack is also well done, minimalist and adds in much without distorting the game.

Overall(10/10)
Recommended for FPS players.

Half Life 2 is incredible. To this day its graphics are solid and the storyline is something out of a novel. Great first-combat mixed with puzzles within a universe like no other. Not to mention that this game keeps you on the edge of your seat from beginning to end. Absolutely recommend.

A true classic,if not THE best Valve game you will play.

10/10

Gordon Freeman.
Gordon Freeman has the letter 'G' in it.
Do you know what else has the letter 'G' in it?
Thats right.
The galapagos penguin.
The galapagos penguin is a bird.
Do you know what else is a bird?
Thats right.
The chuck Will's widow
But what do birds have to do with Half Life, you say.
Lets find out!
So far we mentioned 2 birds.
The word ''two'' contains 3 letters.
The word ''letters'' contains 2 letters 'T'
2 + 3 - 2 = 3

We need Half Life 3 !!!

An absolute masterpiece of a video game.

I decided to go on an achievement-hunting rampage the past few days and Half Life has been incredibly fun to 100%, and the game had some good replayability there.

Lots of fun, INCREDIBLE for its 2004 release (Though I may be biased in my standards as a TF2 player), and after playing through the series there are so many jokes and references I now understand.

Thank you Valve for not making me fight any Ichthyosaurs in this one.
